intro: Discostigma febrile, commonly known as the fever plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Discostigma febrile is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
